material.mattext: What are the two major sections in a coprocessor?
control unit and numeric control unit
floating point unit and coprocessor unit
coprocessor unit and numeric control unit
Which are the processors based on RISC?
Which is the first company who defined RISC architecture?
Which of the following processors execute its instruction in a single cycle?
How is memory accessed in RISC architecture?
Which of the following is serial access memory?
Which of the following memories has more speed in accessing data?
What is the purpose of address bus?
to provide data to and from the chip
to select a location within the memory chip
Which of the following decides which task can have the next time slot?
Which of the following provides a time period for the context switch?
Which interrupt provides system clock in the context switching?
Which of the following contains all the task and their status?
Which determines the sequence and the associated task’s priority?
all processes have the same priority
a task must be serviced by its deadline period
process scheduling can be done only once
Hard real time operating system has______________ jitter than a soft real time operating system.
For real time operating systems, interrupt latency should be ____________.
The problem of priority inversion can be solved by ____________
both priority inheritance and inversion protocol
Time duration required for scheduling dispatcher to stop one process and start another is known as ____________
Which one of the following is a real time operating system?
To schedule the processes, they are considered _________
If the period of a process is ‘p’, then what is the rate of the task?
The scheduler admits a process using __________
The ____________ scheduling algorithm schedules periodic tasks using a static priority policy with pre-emption.
Rate monotonic scheduling assumes that the __________
processing time of a periodic process is same for each CPU burst
processing time of a periodic process is different for each CPU burst
periods of all processes is the same
In rate monotonic scheduling, a process with a shorter period is assigned __________

There are two processes P1 and P2, whose periods are 50 and 100 respectively. P1 is assigned higher priority than P2. The processing times are t1 = 20 for P1 and t2 = 35 for P2. Is it possible to schedule these tasks so that each meets its deadline using Rate monotonic scheduling?
If the instruction, Add R1, R2, R3 is executed in a system that is pipe-lined, then the value of S is (Where S is a term of the Basic performance equation)?
The average number of steps taken to execute the set of instructions can be made to be less than one by following _______
When performing a looping operation, the instruction gets stored in the ______.
Which of the following is/are types of embedded systems?
Which of the following is/are advantages of embedded systems?
Choose example(s) of RTOS from below.
The Bus width of PIC is
What causes Deadlock? c No preemption
What is the speed of PIC?
6 Clock/instruction cycle, operating Frequency up to 30MHz.
4 Clock/instruction cycle, operating Frequency up to 20MHz.
2 Clock/instruction cycle, operating Frequency up to 10MHz.
8 Clock/instruction cycle, operating Frequency up to 40MHz.
What are the features of USB?
Up to 127 devices can connect to the host, either directly or by way of USB hubs
With USB 2.0, the bus has a maximum data rate of 480 megabits per second (10 times the speed of USB 1.0).
The computer acts as the host
Many USB devices can be put to sleep by the host computer when the computer enters a power-saving mode
What are the characteristics of RTOS? d Reliability
In Synchronous communication Two clock is used for both transmitter and receiver
In Asynchronous communication Single different clocks are used for both transmitter and receiver
Synchronous communication is Used for transferring block of data at a time
Asynchronous communication is Used to transfer one character at a time
This requirement dictates that an embedded system must perform fast enough to fulfill its timing requirements.
Because RTOS can be used in a wide variety of embedded systems, they must be able to scale up or down to meet application-specific requirements
Only Load and Store instructions can reference memory
Von Neuman architecture Requires single bus for instructions & data
